Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: playlist helper
des:
So you have a smartphone and an Alexa. That means your phone is paired to Alexa via Bluetooth, so all your music plays through Alexa.

After you get home from a long day of work and you listen to some new music. 

So you're listening to Spotify and an awesome brand new track comes on and you think “I really want to add this really cool song to your awesome rock and roll playlist on Spotify”.

That’s exactly why I made Playlist Helper! 

Now, anytime you're listening to music and you come across a song EVEN from somebody else's playlist that you likes.... 

All you have to do is say: 

"Alexa, ask Playlist Helper to add song to my rock classics playlist!"

Playlist Helper will automatically add the song which is currently playing will be added to the playlist. 

Playlist Helper enables you to easily add or remove songs from your Spotify playlist using only your voice. Currently Playlist Helper only supports Spotify. Stay tuned for more updates.
*In order to use Playlist Helper enable the 3rd party app and link your Spotify account using the Alexa app

Here are the key phrases and how to use them: 
Add songs to your playlist by saying “Add song to rock and roll playlist”: this will add the current song being played by your Spotify account to your rock and roll playlist
Check what song has been added by saying “What song did I add?”:You need to ask what song did I add to ensure the song has been added successfully to your playlist
Remove the song that you just added by saying “Remove song”: Remove song removes the most recent song added to your playlist that Playlist Helper added
Create playlists by saying "Create new playlist Groovy Tunes”: Creates a new playlist on your Spotify account
